column5: To have technical advisors and support on the training of the relevant section personals.

column4: Its a very good and useful tool for countries to monitor the FCTC. Training for the capacity building of national staff at country level in this area would be very useful.

This reporting instrument is far less user friendly that the 2014 report. This instrument does not allow for collaboration across and within Government, as there is no way to save externally and allow the WHO FCTC focal points to seek additional information that falls outside the health scope. For example, to ensure accuracy, Australia usually sends the report to colleagues at customs and  tax offices to ensure we report accurate seizure and tax information. This was not possible with this report as we couldnt guarantee that unrelated answers wouldnt be changed by accident, and the submitting officer needs to be accountable for all responses in the instrument. 

Further, Australia assumes that we will be sent our final responses for official record keeping purposes, but in the absence of this, the new instrument does not allow Parties to take responsibly for their own record keeping.  We note this is particularly important for consistency of responses between reporting periods.  

Australia had many problems with saving our responses, with the internet connection timing out and cutting out many times, resulting in the reporting instrument having to be reviewed many more times than in previous years, to ensure that input was saved as intended. 

Australia would welcome a return to the old reporting instrument.

This year the format was web-based but not user friendly. We attached many documents but none were received by you. There was also no save button at each stage and near each question, which would have helped. I totally disliked the new reporting instrument and feel  that a better job could be done in the future. Maybe you can find a different company to do it for you. I suggest you make a group from those who really fill this for you and test it with them in a one day meeting.
The reporting instrument is very braod based and all encompassing and can be more concise.

column5: More frequent meetings/teleconferences of national focal points more available transfer of FCTC reports possible technical visits of Secretariat to some countries with strong tobacco lobby support on collection of data from non-health sectors

Nous avions relevé quelques petites insuffisances de forme dans la conception de l’instrument de notification qui pourraient être améliorées ultérieurement. Il s’agit :
Le point 3.2.4.4 sur « Utilisation des directives adoptées par la COP » ne peut être renseigné parce que l’espace consacré à cet effet n’est pas activé.
Il n’existe pas de box relatifs aux options de réponses « NON » de point 5.2.

Canada encourages the continued efforts of the WHO to develop synergies in the WHO reporting tools used to collect data on national and subnational activities on tobacco control. 
Canada would also encourage the development of a scaled reporting process that could serve the needs of Parties with tobacco control programs in transition by reporting on early implementation activities. while more robust/detailed reporting processes could be developed for Parties with fully implemented programs.

column4: To categories the reporting instruments into Regional aspects.  For example - WPRO, AMRO, EURO Region etc.....: all countries under each region could have it own reporting instrument.  And another suggestion, if the regional office could table the global report to the main office in Geneva, where each country under each WHO Regional office can submit the report straight to the Regional WHO office that is responsible for these countries.

Se han encontrado problemas para activar las macros y obtener el documento en Word, además de tener el link con el que llenar el cuestionario online.
Además, problemas para añadir cuadros con información, con la intención de transmitirla de manera adecuada, sencilla y clara. 
Finalmente, en la pregunta B12 (Prevalencia del consumo de tabaco para fumar en la población adulta por grupos de edad) cabe mencionar que no permite establecer decimales; por lo tanto, los datos contestados no corresponden exactamente a los de la fuente mencionada. Es por ello, que se recomienda para siguientes encuestas, permitir contestar con decimales.

column4:
This revised/current reporting instrument is great, however, instead of a link sent on an email reminder, a website with username and password provided to all member countries could be better.  Also, a save button along with the resume later button could be very useful too. Both suggestions are good for countries like us with slow internet connection. It makes it easier for us to log in to the site whenever possible, and make necessary edits to any parts of it, or continue on any sections that we left blank. 

It would also be helpful if the % of survey completed was updated each time a response is entered and is relevant to the whole survey, not just certain sections.

With this new instrument, we experienced some difficulties - there were times that we had to restart all over again as we were not prompted to the sections we left blank or to continue, and sometimes the page did not save the answers automatically - all of which is due to our slow internet connection. Thank you.
